definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.chinese: 雪花輕輕地落在窗玻璃上。

sentences.english: Snowflakes were swirling in the air.
It's snowing out of shopwindow, snow flakes dancing in the air.
sentences.chinese: 櫥窗外正在下着雪，雪花在空中飛舞。

sentences.english: The lattice of every snowflake is six-sided in shape.
sentences.chinese: 每一片雪花的晶格都是六邊形的。

sentences.english: The decomposed snowflake structure visualizes the hierarchical structure of dimensions very well.
sentences.chinese: 分解的雪花型結構很好地展示了維度的層次結構。

sentences.english: However, when the snow continued to the South Sala , has become a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 然而當雪花持續不斷撒落到南方時，卻成了一種災難。

sentences.english: Seen under a microscope , a fresh snowflake has a delicate six-pointed shape.
sentences.chinese: 在顯微鏡下觀察，剛飄下的雪花呈精巧的六角形。

sentences.english: Snowflakes clung to his eyebrows and to the fur trim of his jacket and cap.
sentences.chinese: 眉毛上掛着雪花，茄克的毛邊和帽子上都是雪。

sentences.english: Is the newly bought cream OK with you?
sentences.chinese: 新買的雪花膏用着行嗎？

sentences.english: Snow globes are a kind of very popular gift.
sentences.chinese: 裏面有雪花的玻璃是一種非常受歡迎的禮物。

sentences.english: Sent a bumper grain harvest in the autumn, dancing snowflakes in winter has finally arrived.
sentences.chinese: 送走了五穀豐登的秋天，雪花飛舞的冬天終於來臨了。

sentences.english: Snowflakes were patting against the windowpane.
sentences.chinese: 雪花輕輕拍打着玻璃窗。

sentences.english: The snow decorated the car with a new look.
sentences.chinese: 飄然而至的雪花把這輛汽車重新雕塑了一番。

sentences.english: She says she enjoys planting smaller ones like snowdrop bulbs.
sentences.chinese: 她說她很喜歡像雪花蓮種植規模較小的燈泡。

sentences.english: Snow 'dappled his shoulders. His ears were red.
sentences.chinese: 他肩膀上落滿斑斑點點的雪花，耳朵凍得通紅。

sentences.english: The "Snow Flower" producers hope they can change the trend.
sentences.chinese: 《雪花祕扇》的製片人希望他們能改變這個趨勢。

definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall
frost forming a pattern on a surface/rime
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
Daxue or Great Snow, 21st of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st December
(of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
